name: Paladin Bael
descriptions: Paladin Bael is a Brotherhood of Steel paladin in charge of guarding the entrance to the Citadel in Fallout 3.

Bael is an experienced fighter, but his conversational skills leave something to be desired. However, his commanding presence ensures that unwanted visitors stay well away from the Citadel's entrance.

Although he is initially dismissive and hostile towards the Lone Wanderer and their abilities, as he would be towards any other wastelander, After the Battle of Project Purity, he ceases to guard the gate.
Bael guards the Citadel's gate until Take it Back! is completed.

topics.topic: FFPAWhoCan someone in the Citadel train me to wear Power Armor?
topics.topic_text: Can anyone in there teach me how to use power armor?
topics.response_text: Of course. But you'd have to secure the permission of Elder Lyons and well... I just don't see that happening. So move along.
You! You're back! We... We all thought... you know.

topics.topic_text: What can you tell me about the Brotherhood of Steel?
topics.response_text: I can see you're trying to appeal to my good nature. Pity for you I don't have one.
You're standing in front of the Citadel, headquarters to the Brotherhood of Steel. Capital Wasteland detachment.
Negative. No Super Mutants, civilians or traveling salesmen allowed.

topics.topic_text: Anything about the Super Mutants I should know?
topics.response_text: Yeah, the city ruins are crawling with them. They've pretty much overrun all of old D.C.

conversation.response_text: I'm sorry, ma'am. No unauthorized civilians allowed inside the Citadel. You'll have to leave now.
